author: Moneylife Digital Team
title: Urban Inflation
text:
Follow @mldigital 
Combined inflation for urban and rural areas increased marginally, to 5.40% in June 2015, from 5.01% in May. Inflation in urban areas increased to 4.55% in June from 4.41% in May. Food inflation in urban areas increased to 5.41% in June from 5.08% in May. In urban areas, inflation of vegetables remained steady at 6.77% year-on-year. Inflation related to fuel & power also remained steady at 3.60% in June. Inflation for housing, too, was steady at 4.48%. Inflation for clothing remained unchanged at 4.88%; for miscellaneous items, it increased to 3.39% in June from 3.13% in May. More in Moneylife
